channel.title: Politics in the twentieth century
channel.description:
This series consists of moderated panel discussions on American political affairs in the mid-20th century. It features Samuel Lubell, Professor Charles Nixon and others.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Whither Dixie
item.description: This program discusses changes in the American south.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The politics of revenge
item.description: This program, "The Politics of Revenge," is an examination of the myth of isolationism in American politics.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Divided we plow
item.description: This program, "Divided We Plow," is an examination of the place of the farmer in American politics.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Ellis Island to Capitol Hill
item.description: This program, "Ellis Island to Capitol Hill," examines the impact that immigrant families have on American politics.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The Negro on the move
item.description: This program discusses the African-American role in American life and politics.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: What next for the unions
item.description: This program, "What Next for the Unions," is an examination of organized labor as a political force.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The waiting game
item.description: This program, "The Waiting Game," is an examination of domestic politics versus the Cold War.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Revolt of the moderates
item.description: The role of the middle class in contemporary politics.
item.dc:creator: San Bernardino Valley College
item.dc:subject: World Politics
